website_summaries.verdict: An incredibly fast wireless mouse with good ergonomics, though its side toggles may need a design rethink.
pros: Minimal to no lag on wireless connection (as long as line of sight is clear)
Thumb buttons are easy to access without impeding side control
Outstanding battery life of hundreds of hours
cons: Top side buttons are uncomfortable to reach and place a little too high for the thumb
Button action can fail after a year or so of constant use
Some aren’t happy with the programming limitations

customer_reviews.title: not good for gaming
customer_reviews.text: the mouse looks and feels greate, but i really got disapointed with the product, it lags a lot, not only on the movement, sometimes it does not recognize the buttons until you click again. i installed official drivers and used in all the endurance and performance modes.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: battery life issue
customer_reviews.text: This is the second G602 I have bought. The first one was good and finally after 2 years it has some double click issue and I decided to buy a new one. However, this second one I bought is really bad, in terms of battery life. Even in endurance mode, I have to change battery like every 8-10 days, comparing to around 1 month or even more for my first one. By the time I realized this, the return window already passed. So I leave this review just to remind others that if you found this issue, return it as soon as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Kangbo Hao

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable product and Horrible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I received a product that worked for 6 months then began having problems. The first problem was the middle mouse button stopped working. The second problem was receiver stopped working and the mouse became about as useful as a rock. I got in contact with customer service and got it shipped out to them but, I still do not have a mouse and it has been over a month. They also do not ship to PO boxes so if you are in college like me it is going to be very hard to work with Logitech. The performance of this mouse is unacceptable and Logitech should be ashamed of their customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mouse, gimped by a never ending middle-click flaw
customer_reviews.text: I own G602 mice for both my home and my office. This mouse is perfectly weighted, very comfortable, has a great battery life, and performs extremely well. BUT... The middle click button on these mice constantly, repeatedly go out. 6 months to 1 year in, the G602 will begin to require very hard presses to register a middle click. Each of my two G602's have been replaced twice under warranty for this issue (6 mice total!), until they have no more warranty, leaving me with a dud of a mouse since I heavily rely on the middle click button. This mouse has been out for over 6 years now, and Logitech has NEVER resolved this in their manufacturing process.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I love logitech as a whole. I have been a fan even since the z313 speaker system. This mouse was an upgrade from an old corded mouse that my friend gave me, which worked fine but my heathen cats couldn't refrain from chewing. The good: -Multiple dpi settings which is helpful because i turn it up for work and everyday use -Attractive mouse overall -2 different mouse settings, gaming and economic to help with battery life -Is comfortable to use and ergonomic -Affordable -No lag whatsoever -No ugly cords Cons: None! Ps- I gave 1 star for volume control because this is review is for a mouse so I feel like that shouldn't be apart of the review
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Thomason

customer_reviews.title: Theoretically a good mouse
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this mouse for the past couple months, but I'm just going to point out the stuff that the good reviews seem to have missed: - The mouse seems very nice, but, upon actually using it with the receiver only 2 feet away from the mouse, connection sometimes has moments where it randomly gets lost every couple of seconds while gaming, even with new batteries. - The programmable keys sometimes have to be pressed twice to get them to register, and sometimes the logitech software thinks I have pressed the programmable key multiple times when I only press it once.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: have 2 and both had the scroll die on me.
customer_reviews.text: so the headline states the problem. if you use the scroll in moderate it'll be fine. I use it for gaming and both of my scroll click broke on me. on top of that i have warranty on it and i called logitech for a replacement and they accepted my replacement then told me to destroy my mouse so i won't have to send it in for replacement. I've destroyed my mouse and send in the video proof and it's been 10 days and they never reply any of my emails. so i'm left with a broken mouse and no replacement and no idea when they'll reply my email. don't buy this if you want this for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: DanyoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Complete JUNK! Never paired!
customer_reviews.text: Received new in the box. NO MANUAL! Had to search online when computer wouldn't recognize it. Found manuals and LOGITECH CONNECTION SOFTWARE MENTIONED NOWHERE ON THE BOX OR IN ANY DOCUMENTATION. Downloaded software that failed to work. Called tech support. Software ON LOGITECH WEBSITE WAS TWO FULL VERSIONS BEHIND THE LATEST RELEASE! Downloaded new version and STILL item failed to work. Removed and returned. Deleted Logitech software. Bought a Microsoft mouse instead that worked first try.
customer_reviews.author: Derek A. Wade

customer_reviews.title: The wireless receiver has major issues.
customer_reviews.text: This one must be a lemon. I've tried the paper trick and a usb extension. I’ve tried 2 different sets of batteries. This mouse *with the dongle in a straight line of sight* constantly loses signal.
customer_reviews.author: MBlevs

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse but poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: Pro's: Great for gaming with lots of programmable buttons and easy-to-use Logitech software. Like the scroll-wheel, not too "clicky" and not too fast. Con's: The batteries should last a lot longer! I barely use the thing because I've been playing a lot of games that I use a steam controller with. The only thing I can guess is that even though I switch it off the batteries are still draining? May just contact Logitech for warranty service.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G. Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Nice gaming mouse...
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a nice cheap gaming mouse because I typically use a trackball for everything else. After a couple weeks of searching and researching I found this little gem. The mouse is a perfect fit for my hands (I have pretty big hands), the center mouse wheel is comfortable to use (unlike some gaming mouses that have hard plastic wheels), and it slides smoothly across my mouse pad. The only issue I have is with the buttons on the side where my thumb is, I tend to accidentally click them when going for long side runs (I have 4 monitors). But all-in-all, I give this mouse my full recommendations for being my gaming mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Jwhit

customer_reviews.title: Oversensitive Right Click
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse... I hate this mouse... Everything is very well designed and the battery life is unparalleled. It fits the hand very well. ...until you have a finger anywhere near the right mouse button. I have two of these and the problem is identical in both. No pressure is required to press the right mouse button. None at all, you'll just right click all the time unless you keep your finger on the rail next to the button. Embarrassing mistake for such an expensive piece of hardware... but then again... Logitech has a track record of expensive equipment having a massive deal breaker flaw...
customer_reviews.author: Martin Jaszczuk

customer_reviews.title: An excellent upgrade at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I'd used the Logitech M203 for years as my office and general-purpose mouse, including gaming. When I saw this on sale - and my M203 had bit the dust - I knew it was time to upgrade. I'm definitely happy that I had. The fit is good for my hand (large palm, shorter fingers) and comfortable for long periods of use. The thumb-rest is new to me and I appreciate it also. I haven't had the need to program in the extra buttons yet but I imagine they'll be useful at some point. Meanwhile, it's a perfectly suitable mouse for general use with occasional bouts of intense gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Hectate

customer_reviews.title: Lags while gaming
customer_reviews.text: Update: Since I've written this review, this mouse is now starting to completely fail. The sensor is going bad and is skipping severely. I will never buy Logitech again. All of their mouses have been failing in under a year for me. The mouse lasted for about five months. -- I got this as a temporary replacement while I wait for my G502 under warranty (had clicking issue), and this mouse lags while gaming. I cannot suggest using this mouse for other than daily tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Office Use
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a gamer, but I work at a PC all day like a lot of people. I've programmed the buttons for: - Forward/Back on internet browser - Copy/Paste - CTRL-Page Up/Down for Excel worksheets - Cycle browser tabs - Cycle DPI on mouse It makes computer work just a little bit faster, especially repetitive tasks. I had an Anker programmable mouse for a few years, but wore out some buttons. I upgraded to this mouse, got it at a fairly good price and very happy it is wireless. I am still on the first set of batteries (1 week of usage), so I'm hopeful I can get a long time between battery changes.
customer_reviews.author: Jake A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Gaming Mouse for the money
customer_reviews.text: My children play video games on a Dell Laptop. I didn't want to invest heavily in equipment for a 12 y/o; needless to say the odds of a mouse falling down the stairs and going to the great peripheral resting place in the sky is too great. I expected to compromise on quality of the materials and performance based on the price. I was wrong on both accounts - really well built product and excellent performance. The Logitech Gaming console software (free download from Logitech) isn't mentioned with the product, but it's really awesome for configuring the mouse and other gaming peripherals. Great product. Very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jim in Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Receiver dies out
customer_reviews.text: A year after purchase date, the usb receiver started to crap out. I have to fiddle around with it and it will work for a few hours and start to go haywire again. Happens in 5 separate USB ports, so its not my ports that are the problem. This should not be a problem for such an expensive mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Alex W.

customer_reviews.title: Old garbage
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a wireless solution for my iMac because I can't stand apple's mouse. Unfortunately, this mouse is apparently older, it lags at an unable rate, there is no driver support anywhere on Logitech website, the G-gaming software identifies the mouse but says that it is in its sleep state even though it is on, making the buttons useless to not be able to program, not that it mattered in the first place because the tracking was atrocious to begin with. There a reason that this mouse "on sale" for less than half of its MSRP, because its a steaming turd of a mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Very good mouse but still a bit heavy. Middle button no longer works in less than 1.5yrs
customer_reviews.text: Ergonomic and good looking. Still a bit heavy for a gaming mouse but expected since it's wired. Connection is not always the best even though the receiver is not that far. Responsiveness is sometimes slight slowed, not sure if battery or again the connection is not the best. Worst, is that the middle button stopped working in less than 1 and a half yrs. Scrolling and left, rigth depress of mid button works fine but I can't click down to make it activate. Other mice mid button still works on same device. Trying to go through warranty right now.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Sho

customer_reviews.title: Awesome customer service
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a replacement for my replacement. My left mouse button started double clicking less than a year after I purchased the mouse. I contacted Logitech and after jumping through a few hoops to prove there was really something wrong with it, they sent me a replacement. Unfortunately, my husband tossed his keys down from upstairs onto my desk and they happened to bounce off my replacement mouse, breaking the scroll wheel. lol Figuring that probably wasn't covered by the warranty, I just jumped on Amazon and ordered another replacement. FYI - it's $50 cheaper on Amazon than it was in the store I originally got it from. Really love this mouse. =D
customer_reviews.author: Madame Rue

customer_reviews.title: extremely short range.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely super short range. Dongle was plugged in front USB port that with in my arm length yet mouse stutters and skips a beat which is very annoying. I had spare extension cord so I extended to within 6 inches and double taped down so dongle won't move around. Now works perfectly but really should have better range. Also battery shows to be at half when I only used a week of light web browsing only. It's possible mouse I got was sitting on shelf for very long time and battery was low to begin with. I am not sure as I've install the software week later and notice it.
customer_reviews.author: SuperM

customer_reviews.title: Needs work...
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is okay, but not really worth the money. The mouse speed is very inconsistent compared to a normal mouse, I think this might have something to do with the wireless connectivity. They provide USB extenders in the packaging, I imagine to try and correct this issue, but then I have a wire... When not placed on a mouse pad, the laser is glitchy and barely works so you definitely need to use it with a mouse pad. The ergonomic design is okay, but the buttons on the left side come down a little too far and interfere with gripping the mouse properly when not using the buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Ballester

customer_reviews.title: Best Gaming mouse under $50
customer_reviews.text: Honestly an amazing gaming mouse. I have had mine for 2 years and still use it for everything. Aside from the G900 and G903, probably the best wireless mouse out right now and definitely the best one for under $50. I would recommend spending a little more and getting this mouse than ending up buy a new, but cheap, gaming mouse every couple of months. Pros: -Light weight -Ergonomic fit that makes it comfortable during hours of use -Sleek design that works for gaming and all day use -Really reliable Cons: -Batteries start to die more frequently after a year -No light control -After 2 years, sometimes needs to be restarted in order to register clicks
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Good value, pretty good for gaming, smooth handling
customer_reviews.text: I am not difficult with mouse choice but lately I developed carpel tunnel of sorts if I wrote it correctly. I use a strap around my wrist but the point is that the mouse is big enough and well constructed for men palms and I can still use the mouse very well and effortlessly. It's pretty smooth. 4 stars because I had to go look for the mouse software which was not easy to find. I use 4k screen and the mouse software windows is ridiculously too tiny. There might be a way to expand it bigger but it's so small I cannot read without hurting my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine H

customer_reviews.title: seriously the best mouse I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I use a ton of macros. I'm a professional geek. The macros are very limited and not too useful, but what I really was impressed and surprised by was the g10 and g11 button able to change the dpi settings, live and on the fly. I use at least 3 monitors and the time it takes to travel between them can be annoying and I have no problem ramping up the sensitivity of the mouse. And other people like my wife can't stand it and can lower the sensitivity on the fly. Overall it is the best mouse I've ever owned in 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R. Anterola

customer_reviews.title: Very UN-impressed
customer_reviews.text: Revised Review - The mouse started out excellent. Comfortable, convenient placement, ergonomic, etc. however, I am barely 3 months in with this and it no longer works at all. The lights come on when powered on, but does not move the cursor at all when I use it. Was extremely happy with this product, but I now feel the exact opposite. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Wright

customer_reviews.title: BAttery life sucks!
customer_reviews.text: Used everyday for 6-8 hours usually in performance mode and after 6 moths the battery life started going downhill. At this point 14 months later im down to 24 hours of battery life. Logitech message me to resolve this please I know the warranty is probably up, but this is just a faulty mouse from what ive read on reviews. Honestly I loved this mouse until I got down to a week of battery life. Im actually sad about it, also the Lights stopped working yesterday :( (Never dropped smashed or spilled on.)
customer_reviews.author: Jordan P

customer_reviews.title: Died after one year
customer_reviews.text: I used this mouse occasionally for about one year. I have never unplugged the receiver from the computer USB port. However, it died. I spent hours online to look for solutions. The Logitech CONNECT software 2010 version (new version can not connect to the receiver) shows that the Mouse constantly gets inactive. I never dropped the mouse and always used it carefully. Folks, please pay attention to the negative reviews on this product. The G602 mouse feels comfortable but it has a short lifespan. The receiver is dead and the replacement from 3rd part costs $20. It does make sense to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: MassPro

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. I use rechargeable batteries with it and they last a long time - over a week of gaming 2-3 hours a night, as well as general PC use. The sensitivity is great, it's very comfortable for my small hands and the side buttons are easily accessible. I have the receiver plugged into my keyboard and have never had any lag issues. The price point is also really hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Loz

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the best purchases of the year for me. I’ve always had regular/in-expensive mouses before, but when Amazon had this great deal, I couldn’t pass it up. Here’s a list of why I love this mouse... 1. The build quality, it has a nice balanced weight to it. Not too heavy, but not light making it feel cheap. 2. The shape of the mouse, it has a nice arc so the palm rests so nice and comfortablely. 3. The little design features like a thumb rest. 4. The click wheel is very smooth 5. Bottom of the mouse is elevated just a bit in three areas, this makes the mouse glide so nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin F.

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse for my Carpal Tunnel
customer_reviews.text: For some reason this mouses shape is a HUGE relief for my carpal tunnel. I have tried dozens of other mice and none have had the effect this one does.. This is probably my 5th or 6th one NOT due to quality issues but due to the fact that i travel with them and they end up getting ruined over time in my briefcase and bags.. The original one i purchased years ago is in perfect condition as its for my home computer and doesn't travel with me.. If you have hand or wrist issues BUY THIS MOUSE, gaming or not its perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Seidel

customer_reviews.title: I like it, and i'm picky.
customer_reviews.text: Takes just a bit to get used to the ergonomics of it, but not too long. Uses the battery way faster than my old Microsoft 5000 mouse, but I also wonder if my batteries are just getting older - rechargeables - Energizer / Duracell. I still can't hit the right buttons when I need to. May just be me. Might take more practice. Bought it on Prime Day for a steal, and never thought I could find a mouse that fits me since I have been using a Microsoft 5000 for... 8+ years? Been through two of them in that time. But I got used to this one well enough in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Nondescript

customer_reviews.title: Get something else, Has major lag issues
customer_reviews.text: So Ive owned this mouse for about 5 months and I have been having nothing but issues with it, My PC is less than 2 feet away from the mouse and the cursor repeatedly cuts out and jerks around all over the screen for no reason at all. This is on my main gaming PC with a GTX 1070. It is so frustrating to use and clicking anything with precision is impossible due to the tracking issues. Ive debated on returning it but wanted to see if it was a driver or USB issue, But I tested it on my laptop and it has the same lag and jerky cursor. I dont understand what is going on here.
customer_reviews.author: MastaX

customer_reviews.title: Battery hog
customer_reviews.text: Using the mouse as I write this review. I LOVE the heft of the mouse and how it moves. But logitech makes multiple incompatible software for its mouse and keyboard. The Logitech keyboard I'm using requires different software from the mouse. The mouse software is very large and provides dubious functionality. Guzzles through dry cells at an alarming rate. So I ended-up uninstalling all the software, and using it like a plain 2-button mouse. All its bells and whistles are wasted because of the battery drain and incompatible software.
customer_reviews.author: BostonTech99

customer_reviews.title: double click, mouse issue, issue
customer_reviews.text: Mouse quite decent. It feels great. Plays well. Obviously wired mouse's feed back better. But one and only and the biggest issue is durability. This mouse will get that double tap thing. /when you click mouse 1 button it will double click./ It toke me around to get that issue. And I'm not gamer. I play dota or some fps games twice a week around 3 hours of game time. So if you are planning to purchase this mouse for gaming I would suggest you go for zowie or something like that.
customer_reviews.author: Chintogtokh

customer_reviews.title: G602 gaming mouse - great for lightroom and photoshop
customer_reviews.text: A reasonably priced gaming mouse. I do not play many games and use the mouse most for working on Lightroom and Photoshop but it works very well and the customizable buttons help automate some basic tasks. Pros: Great battery life A good fit and wieght Adjustable DPI 8 thumb buttons than can be customized Minor cons: Does not use the unified receiver so if you have a Logitech keyboard you will need to use two USB ports.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Chick

customer_reviews.title: Looks good feels good - Learn how to ship
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned when I received this mouse because the packaget was pretty badly beaten up. The package was smashed with enough force to collapse most of the plastic that shrouded the mouse. Furthermore, the package was shipped in a shipping envelope..... That's fine, but then logistics companies should handle these products with more care. Not load the elephant sized heavy boxes on top of it. Overall it seems like a pretty nice mouse. Still trying to figure out all the function but after downloading the logitech customizer online it has some customizability, at least enough for me. Not sure what the difference in performance when toggling the performance/longevity button. All in all good purchase just beware shipping.
customer_reviews.author: ME Merit

customer_reviews.title: 2500 DPI max. Superb configurability. Battery life not that good on performance settings.
customer_reviews.text: In Overwatch, you can bring down your sens to 1.5 or less with this baby. 2500 dpi does make a difference. However, this will drain batteries in about 24 hours, so have rechargeables at hand. I bought it for like 25 bucks which is a steal. Even if its an older model, it has all the configurability software of the new mice. You wont get more features from a more expensive mouse necessarily, so don't be fooled. Going above 2500 dpi really won't make a different in your FPS. Pro's usually play around 400 - 1000 dpi so 2500 is way more than enough.
customer_reviews.author: Rummy

customer_reviews.title: Died within a month or two.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the title says it all. This mouse died before the batteries that came with it did. It worked perfectly until one day, and it randomly refused to come on. I attempted to replace the batteries with some new energizers,twice, to no avail. It's rather unfortunate because otherwise it was a great mouse for the price. Unfortunately, I am not in the return window for this mouse, so I have to take the loss.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Not an acceptable replacement for a G500 mouse
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to finally try and replace my ancient G500. The shape of the mouse is pretty good substitute for that one. However, this mouse is really back heavy once the batteries are in, not good if you tend to lift your mouse while moving it. Also the mixed material finish makes it stick to your palm in a couple spots which is distracting. The lack of infinity scroll might also bother you. The side buttons restrict how much space your thumb had to rest. I ended up returning this, not a good enough substitute for the G500.
customer_reviews.author: squishfactor

customer_reviews.title: I shouldn't have waited so long...
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Razer loyalist for years. But now that I travel a lot for work (pilot) and the constant snagging of the mouse cable led me to look for a wireless solution. I was stuck between the G602 and the G403 Prodigy Wireless and ultimately went for this one, the G602. The price was perfect ($39.99) and the performance is amazing. I cannot tell that it is wireless. The ergonomics is fantastic and the 6 thumb buttons take a bit to get used to, but with my medium to small sized hands, I had no issues adjusting to the new form factor. Just get one now and experience wireless freedom.
customer_reviews.author: Junstar

customer_reviews.title: Good for Big Hands
customer_reviews.text: So, I recently received my 2nd G602, bought the last one I believe over 5 years ago and it's worked beautifully ever since. I have large hands and use a modified claw grip so having a large mouse with accessible buttons is key. This one is very smooth and comfortable and has more than enough buttons and ways it can be modified to suit all my general PC and Gaming needs. The new ones wheel feels much better than the old one, (of course it's much newer...)
customer_reviews.author: Jasper

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: If you want a wireless mouse with good battery, this is it. If you're looking for extra buttons for quick selecting functions, this is for you. If you want a gamer grade mouse that doesn't cost as much as a phone, this is cost effective. This sets a new standard for mice. The only people who may not want it are people who just want plane Jane, web surfing mice for under $20. Professionals and gamers should definitely consider buying this. I liked the downloadable app for it and programming buttons was relatively easy. Idk why there's people complaining about programming it being hard or a hassle
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: A pathetic replacement for my G700s.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after my G700s died. I've been all around disappointed with this, but I still use it because there's nothing better on the market. If you're reading this, Logitech, please bring back the G700s. I miss my side-click on the scroll wheel, free-scroll, and all my blind-feel buttons, that I don't need to grope to tell which button I'm pressing, and I miss being able to plug it in while i'm using it, instead of having to replace batteries every few months. It also has horrible lag at times. Oh, and those stupid pieces of plastic on either end of the thumb buttons. I removed them, and you should too. I constantly try to press them.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pfeifer

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse, poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: I can't help but question if there's something wrong with my mouse in particular.... because I have to replace my batteries way too often. I feel like I'm replacing them about every week. I haven't been turning the mouse off when I step away from the computer.... that's on me. But this mouse eats through batteries faster than any mouse I've owned. Decent mouse otherwise. All other aspects of the mouse are great.
customer_reviews.author: A. rollins

customer_reviews.title: G602 Fails at Gaming. Nothing replaces the G700s. UGH!
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviewers mention, the side keys (aka thumb keys, aka gkeys) have to be pressed hard, and often have to be pressed twice. This is unacceptable for competitive gaming. The tracking is good, and battery life is holding up, but if I press a key, it has to respond immediately. It's the difference between winning and losing. I've been gaming with Logitech for nearly two decades, and this is the first time I've decided to look outside their selection for a mouse. Feels like bad. BRING BACK THE G700s!!!!! And the G11 keyboard while you're at it.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa F

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse with some caveats.
customer_reviews.text: Great-feeling mouse. The software is great if you can learn how to use it effectively. Otherwise, accidental clicks on games you haven't mapped a preset for could have unintended results. Battery life is decent. The software will alert you when battery levels get critical. This does require batteries; this mouse is not rechargable.
customer_reviews.author: Frank D

customer_reviews.title: My favorite
customer_reviews.text: I really love this mouse. I do use it for gaming, but it has also proven perfect for everything else I do on my computer. Programming the buttons to 'undo/redo', 'copy/paste' and a few other most-used actions has made my time online much easier. It has also proven invaluable for all my art/PaintShop Pro projects. The price is amazing for all you get and how it performs. I will probably buy one or two more to store so I can always use this great mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable Performance
customer_reviews.text: I've always used Logitech when it comes to mice both for business as well as gaming. This mouse performance has caused headaches all the way through and is the first time I'm considering moving to another manufacturer. The mouse performed flawlessly for the first couple of months, then out of nowhere decides it won't drag with any consistency. Being a technology consultant I know how mice work. Looking at the Logitech forums show the same issues with no fix. Removing HID compliant mouse driver does nothing to fix the issue. Its unfortunate Logitech is losing a longtime customer.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Goddard

customer_reviews.title: Great while it still works...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for about 4 months, then it started lagging terribly. I have to pull the receive to about 6" away, or else it doesn't work properly. I rebooted and recycled power and did everything you can imagine. I am going to go out and buy something different. It sucks, because Logitech makes amazing mice, but they never last very long. I have owned about 4 other models and all have had the same issue. I bought this because it was on a big sale.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy!

customer_reviews.title: Mouse is fantastic but DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Physical mouse feels great, buttons click well, battery lasts forever, no lag (on mmo's anyway). But.... You are forced to use Logitech's Ghub software if you want to customize the buttons. Honestly if I knew how awful and I mean AWEFUL!! this program was before I bought it, I wouldn't have bought it. Its the least intuitive program I have EVER used, I would rather play ET for atari everyday for the rest of my life than use Ghub. So until that program is better DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: biscuitstix

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Wireless Mouse Except For Bad Middle Mouse Button
customer_reviews.text: I tried a TON of wireless mice. I literally purchased like six or seven different models from different manufacturers and tried them all. This one was the best for what I do. Awesome feel and fits great in my large hands, great customizable buttons, has a middle scroll wheel that has increments (useful for my work software). The only problem... the middle mouse button stops working after a while. Mine lasted about 18 months. Google around and you'll see tons of people with this same issue with this mouse. The only upshot is Logitech has a three-year manufactures warranty. Good product except for the mechanical button problems. Very disappointing for a company that has been making mice for years! :(
customer_reviews.author: R. Newton

customer_reviews.title: My favorite mouse for almost 8 years
customer_reviews.text: Ive literally been using this same mouse for like 8 years now. Its perfect for mmo's and games where you need alot of macros or buttons. I just purchased my 3rd one. Ive broken two. No fault to the mouse itself. i have some temper issues and have bounced it off the wall multiple times. Its super comfy for big hands. if i ever find out they aren't going to make this mouse again im buying a dozen of them.
customer_reviews.author: Yama

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely my all-time favorite mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is an older model mouse & is my third one. They were originally $75 - $90, but pretty inexpensive now. I keep a spare on hand in case they get discontinued. Buttons are well placed & easy to find w/o having to break focus to look. Great for gaming, but It's not just for games. I use it for AutoCAD 5 days a week & have my most commonly used commands programmed. This wout also work great for Photoshop/Lightroom or any other programs that use commands.
customer_reviews.author: forrest

customer_reviews.title: Great overall but one major issue
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mouse overall for gaming and general use. One major issue I have at least with mine is that even while off the batteries drain. I thought at first it was due to crappy batteries but switching to name brand AA also had this issue. Every time I pick up this mouse to use the batteries are dead, the solution is to take the batteries out but then this has lead to me forgetting them and not having them for use. If it wasn’t for this issue I would give 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Nightlion

customer_reviews.title: Love not having a wire flopping around ... however
customer_reviews.text: for me, Horrible ergonomics... and my hand/thumb isn't huge... the groove base is too wide and thick making your thumb sit too high making it impossible not to bump the rear buttons in the midst of a battle. In Division or any game your thumb bumps into the the programmed buttons on the back of the mouse. I unassigned 4 of the rear buttons and still, my wired 502 way outperforms and fits my hand Way better than the 602. After getting killed a few times in game and nearly tossing it against the wall I went back to my 502. As a computer mouse for daily work, the 602 is fine... gaming.. its NOT for me -
customer_reviews.author: R. Raney

customer_reviews.title: best mouse for dollar if you dont need Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: This and the MX Master are my two current favorite wireless mice on the market. If you don't need RGB, and don't need wired here are your mice. buy this one if you do gaming, or don't need Bluetooth or a built in rechargeable battery - buy the MX Master if you need Bluetooth, want rechargeable or want side scrolling functionality. Both excellent mice. this is a steal of a deal in the high $20s.
customer_reviews.author: Erik A. Berger

customer_reviews.title: Great macro-gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: Got it on sale for $30 and would probably say it's the best $30 I spent on a gadget. I absolutely love the macros (I use it in conjunction with AutoHotKey) and can do darn near magical things with just the mouse. No product is perfect, and I'd love to see a button that allows the scroll-wheel to toggle between clicking and free-scrolling like even the (cheap but excellent) Logitech M705. But that's no grounds to dock a star because it does what is advertised extremely well; is well built, smooth and will probably be used for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: f3lixioz

customer_reviews.title: BATTERIES...MORE BATTERIES!!!
customer_reviews.text: After using it for about 1.5 years, I cannot recommend this mouse. I have never had any battery operated item eat more batteries than this mouse. Fortunately, I use Eneloop batteries but this mouse still goes through a pair of AA rechargeable batteries in three or four days...and yes I turn off the mouse when shutting down my computer. I have not used alkaline batteries for the simple reasons of cost and I already have rechargeable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Nice wireless mouse
customer_reviews.text: Got this during a lightning deal. Usually go with Logitech mice, and although the software is not ideal (I believe the Logitech Hub software is replacing the Gaming Software, though I can still use the latter even though it hasn't been updated since 2018 IIRC), I do like the feel and convenience of non-wired. Never thought I'd go wireless as I was concerned about the mouse dying in the middle of gaming, but the battery life is actually pretty good (using rechargeable batteries, even) and gives a warning when the batteries are getting low. I think it's pretty cool that you can use only one battery as well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lerma

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit biased as I'm had good luck with Logitech for mice and keyboards before (still use G18 keyboard, and my Logitech mouse finally died after a good 5ish years of frequent use (gaming and work, with a pup ripping it out of the port). This one is responsive with 2 modes, plenty of programmable buttons for MMOs or graphic design shortcuts, and comfortable for a larger hand. The battery did die a bit sooner than expected, but for the price, I am very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LastShotSniper

customer_reviews.title: Great ergonomic mouse, requires AA batteries with USB bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic ergonomic mouse option! I have been using this mouse with the USB bluetooth connection for a few weeks now and its fantastic. Very responsive and scroll wheel moves smoothely. The only quelm is that it uses AA batteries which is a pro and con cuz you need batteries. But there's an on/off switch on the bottom of the mouse, that goes on the table, that can conserve battery when necessary and turn on when you need it. Still have to lift it up to switch it on or off.
customer_reviews.author: marsbar

customer_reviews.title: Nice mouse, but not lag free
customer_reviews.text: Fits my hand well. Just put first set of replacement batteries in it about a month ago. Not the best battery life I've seen in a gaming mouse, but definitely top 5. Used for gaming, photo editing, and basic computer use. With receiver on back of PC (about 6 feet from mouse), there's noticeable lag, with it on front of PC (about 4.5 feet) there's still some minor lag from time to time. I had to put the receiver on my keyboard to eliminate lag. Definitely worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Chaosdsm

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a bunch of different gaming mice with extra buttons for macros, etc. Of all of them, this is the first one I've found where the extra buttons are actually easy to use and don't require gymnastics of the hand to get right. I use an MX3 in my daily work life so, this is close as far as ergonomics goes. The scroll wheel has good tension for gaming and it's wireless although, I wish it was rechargeable and didn't need throw away batteries but, you can't have everything. For the price, this is a great mouse.
customer_reviews.author: MakaniMoku

customer_reviews.title: 1 star might be unfair
customer_reviews.text: I said 1 star might be unfair for a reason, that being that I didn't keep this mouse any longer than it took for me to take it out of the package and put my hand on it. It was just way too small for me. I might have been able to accept the overall size but the buttons on the side by the thumb rest were too close together and crowded the thumb rest to where my thumb was always resting against them. Maybe some people like it that way but I don't. I returned it for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: HC Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Issue Revealed!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Time to update the review after owning the mouse for 2 months. The middle click, or wheel click, has started to have issues. It will register every other click, require a harder press to click, or register a few in a row then not register a few in a row. Middle click is essential as more games/applications use it for key functions such as in Apex Legends. I found numerous posts on the Logitech forums, and all result in RMA warranty requests, which I will be doing as well. Zero Lag, Excellent Battery Life (option to run with either 1 or 2 AA batteries), No Cords, Excellent Software, Excellent buttons.
customer_reviews.author: William W.

customer_reviews.title: 4 Years of Great Use
customer_reviews.text: I have used this mouse for four years and have had no issues until this week. I have used this as my main work and gaming mouse. For work, I programmed the side keys for copy, paste and enter, which has made productivity smoothe. For games, I have mapped the essential hotkeys, which has helped. My experience has been overwhelmingly positive, yet there are a few issues. This device uses batteries very quickly. It additionally is a bit on the big size and takes some time to get used to. This mouse was purchased in September 2014, and I am currently searching for a replacement. The cursor is freezing, and the lights are lighting up afterward on the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Elliott III

customer_reviews.title: Nice mouse, wouldn't recommend it for fast paced shooters.
customer_reviews.text: Nice mouse, works just fine. Personally I really dislike where the side buttons are located, kept pressing them by accident while playing shooters and trying to turn around quickly. I play with a loose/claw grip and basically hit/push the mouse with my thumb when dragging it to the right. It was too heavy with both AA batteries in it. You have the option to use just one, it felt better that way. I ended up buying a different mouse, a Logitech - G502 Proteus Core Optical Gaming Mouse which worked better for me.
customer_reviews.author: E. G.

customer_reviews.title: i really want to like it but
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like it but the sensor in this mouse is utter garbage, it'll have random fits through the day where it will just stutter around the screen to the point where I have to keep a second mouse on standby. Like I said I really do what to like it as its the best ergonomically I've had in a mouse and I love the extra buttons, but when I'm doing my work there's nothing that annoys me more than lag and oh my god is there a ton beiing produced from this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: L.Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless gaming/macro mouse under $30!
customer_reviews.text: Using it for gaming & productivity along with a Logitech G933 wireless headset and a Logitech wireless mouse/keyboard combo. Super responsive and I love how it glides on my desk. I've had it for a few months and even though I don't have the biggest hands, I'm still trying to find my hand placement. I can either have my middle finger on the mouse wheel and float my pinky, or 2-finger the mouse and awkwardly float my 3 other fingers. Don't get me wrong, it feels great in your hand and it's precise.
customer_reviews.author: Marten Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: If you don't middle click, this mouse will last forver.
customer_reviews.text: However if you do middle click, this mouse will only last a year or two (just over a year in my case) without requiring you to desolder and replace the failed tactile switch to regain use of middle click. In my 2.5 years of ownership, I've now replaced the middle click switch twice. Outside of the issue with the middle click switch, I'm quite happy with the mouse, all the other buttons work great, and their placement & quantity are great.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Otte

customer_reviews.title: Sets the bar for wireless mice.
customer_reviews.text: I use this mouse daily for long periods of time, from gaming to editing, and I'll never want to go back to a wired mouse. It's pretty much as lag-free as a wireless mouse could possibly be. I'm not saying MLG players should go wireless, but if they did, this would probably be their go-to. I often forget it needs batteries because they last so long. The only time I noticed a jittery connection was when my phone was right next to the receiver causing interference, so that's pretty much the only downside I've found. Extremely satisfied, especially for the price. I'm buying another one before the expensive newer model takes its place lol
customer_reviews.author: Pocket Change Champ

customer_reviews.title: what? not compatible with Win10?
customer_reviews.text: trying to install the gaming mouse software,..says "sorry, not compatible with your operating system", I have a new laptop with Win10 Home. I've tried 3 times, giving up. The software is obviously antiquated,..for Win7/Win8, but it's what their site pushes me to when I search their site for support/download G602. I hate a product that makes me feel stupid, especially when they have dismal phone support. RETURNING.
customer_reviews.author: Nath

customer_reviews.title: Scroll button plagued with issues
customer_reviews.text: Mouse 3/scroll wheel button seems to fail as soon as 3 years using the product which requires you to take the mouse apart and try to clean it. Ultimately, many folks resort to replacing the button. Not good. I've also started to notice range problems. Good mouse when it works, but this is a Logitech Gaming mouse which is supposed to be based on quality clicking components that last millions of cycles.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: This is my current go to mouse for work and gaming
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite mouse for gaming, with lots of programmable buttons and a good feel. In the past some mice have not properly fit my palm and made my hand and wrist cramp up. This one fits and the buttons are easily reachable. Because of the fit and function, I have one for home, one for work, and one for my laptop. While battery life may not be as long as advertised, I don't have a problem with 3-5 months on rechargeable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: J. T.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother with Logitech Mice
customer_reviews.text: Logitech just released another “great” update yesterday that just broke everything. LGHUB doesn’t even recognize the receiver after uninstalling, reinstalling and deleting all drivers and settings. Fifth...FIFTH time this has happened to a mouse I’ve bought from Logitech. The old mapping software was SOOOO much better and now every few months I can’t even use any of the mice I bought from Logitech because of their “updates”... going with a Razor...can’t stand playing these games. PS. Logitech’s help ticket system fails each time you try to report something...so done already...
customer_reviews.author: HaXxXo VtotheZ

customer_reviews.title: Most excellent mouse. Plenty of options
customer_reviews.text: Most excellent mouse. Plenty of options. Great battery life and comfy for the hand (Even in gaming). Has a durable build. The problem lies in the instructions. There really wasn't much. It sends you to the Logitech website, but doesn't LIST what programs will be needed. I had to find a fellow youtube reviewer, whom turned out to be quite a young man (Perhaps even a child) that knew everything about it and explained it clearly. If it weren't for him I would be on the phone trying to figure this out. There should have been a better set of instructions. Otherwise, I really love this product and will be buying another one really soon. Maybe even a few.
customer_reviews.author: TheKitchenChef

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mouse!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse has an amazing fit for the hand, and all the buttons are easily accessible. The DPI adjustment buttons are a great feature. Never had any lag, it's connected to a USB on my Logitech keyboard right next to it though. The buttons are fairly loud, in case you're streaming or have a sensitive microphone when playing with others. I would recommend it, especially if it is on sale (which it frequently is). I bought another to replace one I had spilled a drink on :3 Great gift too :)
customer_reviews.author: Mark J

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless mouse I've used
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is great!. Tons of buttons for games like WoW, and very responsive for FPS games also. Has some good weight to it also. Logictech software also makes it easy to make adjustments and monitor battery life. I feel it also has great battery life. There are two setting for performance or battery life. I keep it on performance and am very sanctified with battery life, so I figure battery saver would make it seem like they last forever. Would highly recommend for people who want quality wireless products.
customer_reviews.author: zharrisfamily

customer_reviews.title: Works on my glass mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: Works flawless on my indestructible Corepad Magna glass mouse pad. Feel's smaller than my old performance MX but has more buttons and better grip. Also, no stupid scroll button that I really didn't use much. The side buttons feel kinda cheap but you get what you pay for. I was expecting this thing to be heavy with 2 batteries installed but it actually feels lighter than my old performance MX. I seriously can't find anything wrong with it. It's a good mouse that functions well. It does not feel like an expensive mouse, so you must expect some cheapness. The price point is spot on. Quite possibly the best bang for buck mouse out there.
customer_reviews.author: MacGyver

customer_reviews.title: Very good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Haven't had the dreaded left click issue yet. Got this on sale for $25, so even if it only lasts a year, it will be worth it. Software from logitech could use a bit more polish, but acceptable. Dpi settings could use their own dedicated buttons instead of defaulting to the two top programmable ones since I like those for other functions. I have slightly larger hands, so this feels just a tiny bit on the small side for me but for most people I think it would be great. Overall very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: LiCKQuiD

customer_reviews.title: not for twitch gaming
customer_reviews.text: For every day use or games that don't require twitch movements, this is fine. But for shooters, don't get this mouse. I really fared much worse in pubg with this mouse. The second I plugged my Razer wired mouse back in, I instantly felt like I was more accurate and quicker. I also didn't care for all the buttons. The DPI selector buttons right next to your index finger....why? Who changes their DPI that often? All it did was result in accidental presses. The thumb buttons are just too much. 6 buttons crammed together...I never knew exactly which one I was pressing. Either splurge for a lightspeed wireless model, or stick to wired.
customer_reviews.author: Speerdo

customer_reviews.title: Its okay but not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Not too much of a mouse for me but I'll deal with it for now. Max DPI is weirdly low, the G keys are slightly awkward, didn't mind those too much since its not like anyone needs 8000 or 12000 dpi or anything. The bigger problem was the mouse acting up and getting jerky and jittery despite the transmitter being close. I didn't have any microwaves or other wireless things on at the time either, aside the Logitech headset which I would imagine wouldn't effect a product from the same company. I think the size and shape work well for me though. I'll probably go back to the 20$ "who???" brand "gamer" mouse I had a few years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Spur of the Moe♡ment

customer_reviews.title: good DPI control and adjustments
customer_reviews.text: good DPI control and adjustments. no laser but laser is over rated if you ask me, no human can perform to the level of precision that even this mouse can much less a laser. Sturdy and stable. Doesn't use rechargeable batteries, which can be either a pro or con depending on your preference, personally I like it because i dont have to plug it in every night after gaming. Good ergonomic design and reach for buttons, with the exception of the back thumb buttons for anyone with medium to large hands, they can be kinda tough to get used to if you dont utilize them often.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle E Denton

customer_reviews.title: Returned within days
customer_reviews.text: Just up front, I’m a Mac user which may/may not have to do with my issues. However, I did see my same complaints from other Mac users online. In short, I could never use the mouse to it’s full potential because Logitech’s drivers and software are horrendous. Even worse than that, I actually had to restore my Mac because the recommended drivers/software wouldn’t allow my computer to even boot to the desktop! I don’t have the time or desire to figure out a workaround for poor support. Horrible, won’t buy Logitech again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hardesty

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless mouse I have used!
customer_reviews.text: i love this mouse. Has to be one of the best wireless mouse I have ever used. I was apprehensive getting another cordless mouse when others have been terrible but this is not the case. There is no detectable lag from mousing and clicking to the system reacting. Battery life is also great! There are some games that detect that you are using a mouse with multiple buttons and automatically assigns actions to the other buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Shadow eX

customer_reviews.title: Works great, lacking software options
customer_reviews.text: Works great, nice and smooth motion, good response time, and it's still running on the first battery I put in it. My only complaint is with Logitech's software. The previous Logitech mouse I had gave way more options for button configuration that are oddly missing from this mouse's version of the software. Particularly, I had buttons bound to volume control. This was resolved by downloading a third party program that let's me assign them to key binds, but there's no real observable reason why this mouse shouldn't have the same task assignment options.
customer_reviews.author: Cory_S

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse, even if original design is  6+ years old
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is exactly what I was looking for. Excellent battery life, plenty of buttons that are easy to setup. I've been using it for two weeks and the battery bar is still full. It seems to work fine for my surfing the web and MMORPG gaming in economy mode and I have not felt any skips or delays. When this mouse dies (hopefully in a 3 - 5 years) the newer G60X will be out and the software will have little complaints. But I made the right choice as this mouse was only about thirty dollars new (originally around eighty many years ago) and the current G604 is about $99.
customer_reviews.author: Litespeed

customer_reviews.title: Good for online game
customer_reviews.text: I've uses product for over 3 years until it broke and had to reorder it because I liked it so much. While My fingers and hander large it makes it hard to be ergonomic for each button but I'm able to use the side buttons with my thumb fairly easy for 2 of them making games like over watch perfect. I really enjoyed the fact that you can change the sensitivity with a quick hit of your finger which is very important for
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Creteau

customer_reviews.title: Superb mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Usually I am against wireless mice because I don't like having to worry about batteries while I am gaming, but this mouse is different. It really shows how far technology has come since the 2000s. This mouse has a ridiculous battery life while on green mode, which is what I use at work (I bring it with me everyday). It also has a very nice weight to it. Unlike other wireless, or even wired mice, this one is nice and heavy. I can change the DPI on the fly with the two buttons next to the left click. All in all this is a great mouse, especially better if you snag it during a sale, like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro S. Lopez-Lavalle Cockburn

customer_reviews.title: The G502 is much better.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse has way too much buttons. I thought it would be good for gaming and use it for other shortcuts but it's too easy to press on them by accident and too many for my muscle memory. Overkill IMO. Buy it if you want all those customizable buttons but too many...go for the G502, yes it's a bit more $$ but worth it. Not the wireless G502, that's thing cost $150 bones.
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Grip
customer_reviews.text: I've found this mouse much more comfortable than the expensive name-brand that my husband had gifted me. The buttons are a little difficult to navigate for me, but I've never used a gaming mouse before. Learning curve, I imagine. I have to shift my hand about to be able to reach the buttons I need. However, for regular every-day use, it doesn't cramp my hand up like the other more expensive mice. I've always had good luck with Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy once small glitch
customer_reviews.text: This is one excellent gaming mouse for the price. I initially had an issue programming the additional thumb buttons for games. The software basically sux. It is suppose to run for the games and map the additional button. You loose connection and the keys remap to something else. I then realized a very simple trick. Sent the buttons to mouse memory so they stay on the mouse not the software. Then map the buttons to the keys not normally used. Page Up, Page Down, Insert, Home.... Then in games they are select-able options in the key mapping options. You can then throw away the junk software.
customer_reviews.author: N. Seal

customer_reviews.title: Top notch wireless gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: Logitech, you folks have outdone yourself with this gaming mouse. It has replaced all of my previous gaming mice by companies that are supposed to be specialists in gaming mice. The battery life on this mouse is epic, the ergonomics are top notch and my hand always feels like it is resting on the mouse just right. The only con is the weight due to the batteries, but that's something I've gotten used to over time. All in all, this is my go to daily driver and gaming mouse for the foreseeable future.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Incredible mouse + robust software
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse to use at work to Macro various my repetitive tasks and I have to say the software is very good. It doesn't limit the number of actions since it uses your computer's memory over the mouse's and the options are very customizable. As far as the mouse goes, it's really sleek and the ergonomics are great. It's very comfortable to use and looks really nice. The mouse wheel clicks when scrolling for more control and you can map the buttons to do whatever you want with the software. The price point is fantastic. Overall very happy and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cayden Countryman

customer_reviews.title: Failure at one year use
customer_reviews.text: I liked the mouse, it was a good lower cost option for a gaming mouse. Unfortunately, it has failed (seems to be a wireless issue with the connection being intermittent) and now useless. Also surprised that Logitech support is not as good as it used to be. Tried to submit a warranty claim and it won't do it until you go through one of their "experts" turns out experts are only available at some times, but not at the time I tried. I would have be happy with a simple "I'll mail you this one back, you give me a new one" solution.
customer_reviews.author: RGR

customer_reviews.title: Prime Day Price $24.99 great deal
customer_reviews.text: Mouse works great and is good for gaming since my wired mouse kept tangling Pros: Fits my 9" hands great Six programmable buttons 3 settings for mouse movement Rolling and clicking is smooth Cons: Seems to use a little more battery life than normal It would have been great if is supported my pinky finger for faster gaming Wish it had battery power meter since I use rechargeable batteries
customer_reviews.author: Carl R. Young

customer_reviews.title: Not a great gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: You'd think that because 'gaming' is in the title of this mouse, it is designed well for gaming. Personally, I didn't notice any lag and there are a good number of useful programmable buttons. However, many of the programmable buttons Don't register when first pressed. While gaming this is really quite annoying! I have needed to press a button up to three times with varying degrees of pressure to get it to change to a different gun etc. For everyday non-gaming use I'd say this mouse would be just fine. I was just dissatisfied with the product I got as I needed it for gaming primarily.
customer_reviews.author: Gino Luciano

customer_reviews.title: Garbage wireless receiver renders the product useless.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse worked for a few weeks and suddenly stopped connecting, even though no damage was done to the mouse. After weeks of haranguing with Logitech, I shipped them the mouse, they 'honored' their warranty, and I received the 'repaired' mouse. It worked for a scant few days and stopped working again, and stayed as such even after going through all their troubleshooting. One broken mouse is bad luck, twice is a failure in quality control. Logitech wireless tech is unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: crimsoncat

customer_reviews.title: Responsive, programmable mouse with great battery life!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mouse! It has a lot of buttons which are programmable, which helps me work more efficiently, and the pointing is fast and precise. I've had it for about 6 months and have yet to change the battery--though I think it will be running out soon. I definitely recommend this, and it's a pretty good value too! The only thing I would change would be to make it rechargeable, but that's not a huge deal - still my favorite mouse!
customer_reviews.author: nwbanks3391

product_meta.title: Logitech G602 Lag-Free Wireless Gaming Mouse – 11 Programmable Buttons, Upto 2500 DPI
product_meta.description: Without cords, clutter or interference to affect gameplay, the Logitech G602 Wireless Gaming Mouse redefines the laws of wireless gaming by providing up to 250 hours of lag-free gaming battery life. Plus, Logitech's exclusive Delta Zero sensor technology brings high-accuracy cursor control and power-saving optimization. To further extend battery life, the Logitech G602 Wireless Gaming Mouse gives you the option to switch between performance and endurance modes, saving power for when you need it most.Logitech G602 Wireless Gaming Mouse:Wireless technologyOptical tacking sensor11 programmable controlsUp to 2500 dpi tracking resolution3m wireless rangeCompatible with Windows and Mac
feature_bullets: Upto 250 hours of battery life (Best with Polaroid AA Batteries)
